intro: Spicanta deflexa, commonly known as the bent-spine spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, often zigzagging stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to parts of southern Africa. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine, glandular hairs. Spicanta deflexa is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
